page.title: 07FARM EQUIPMENT ON MARK MOOR
page.content: Machinery owned by farmers is mainly Tractors & Bailers. Contractors own more sophisticated equipment which is used for silage making & hedging cutting. All farmers own a refrigerated bulk tank for milk storage & plant for milking. Vehicles all farmers own a pick-up truck with fourwheel drive for transporting small loads from farm to fields. Buildings in this area are needed to house all cattle between November & April. Milking cows are housed in cubicles often with free access to silage face. Calves, beef cattle etc housed in straw yards. Generators are used occasionally in the event of prolonged power failure.
